title: A's Kurtz becomes first rookie with 4-HR game
content: Nick Kurtz of the Athletics became the first rookie in MLB history to hit four home runs in a game, doing so in a 15-3 victory over the Astros on Friday night. He also had 6 hits and 19 total bases.

title: Stewart to join Bengals as rookie reaches deal
content: Shemar Stewart agreed to a four-year, fully guaranteed contract worth $18.97 million with the Bengals, as he became the final first-round draft pick to agree to a deal.

title: Miami: Messi 'extremely upset' with MLS over ban
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said Lionel Messi is "extremely upset" after being given a one-game suspension by MLS for skipping the All-Star Game.

title: Sources: Around 100 NFLers face SB-tix penalty
content: At least 100 players face fines and possible suspension for allegedly selling their allotted tickets to this year's Super Bowl LIX above face value, sources told ESPN.

title: USC lands Hall, No. 1 hoops recruit in 2026 class
content: Saniyah Hall, the No. 1 player in the ESPNW class of 2026, announced her commitment today to USC on ESPN's "NBA Today."

title: NFLPA doc: Financial actions 'may be criminal'
content: A criminal investigation into finances of the NFL Players Association includes potential misuse of funds and self-enrichment by union officials, according to a confidential document obtained by ESPN.

title: Lynx drop 109 on Aces, win 14th in row at home
content: Napheesa Collier scored 25 points, Courtney Williams added 23, and the Minnesota Lynx beat the Las Vegas Aces 109-78 on Friday night for their 14th straight home win.

title: Schwarber reaches 1,000-hit milestone with HR
content: Phillies slugger Kyle Schwarber hit a pair of two-run homers Friday night against the Yankees, including one that gave him 1,000 career hits.

content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen.

title: Exiled by Amorim, what does the future hold for the talented Garnacho?
content: Left at home for the club's U.S. preseason tour, Alejandro Garnacho's time in Manchester is surely coming to an end. But Ruben Amorim might regret casting him aside.

content: Brett Okamoto plays matchmaker and provides five matchups he wants the UFC to make happen by the end of 2025.

title: Spain's chance to shine: Euro 2025 offers opportunity to move past controversy
content: Despite all their success, Spain have never won the Euros, and their 2023 World Cup win was overshadowed by controversy. On Sunday, they hope that the focus will be firmly on them.

content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas: Chief of Army Staff Gen Dwivedi launches three projects to pay tributes to Kargil martyrs
content: Gen. Upendra Dwivedi launched three projects, including a portal where people can pay ‘e-shradhanjali’ to martyrs, as part of the 26th Kargil Vijay Diwas

title: CBI busts cybercrime gang operating from Pune apartments; three arrested
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation arrests cybercrime syndicate defrauding U.S. citizens, seizing cash, narcotics, and incriminating digital evidence in Pune and Mumbai raids

title: Andhra Pradesh Government aims to redefine tourism
content: Andhra Pradesh gears up to celebrate World Tourism Day on September 27, 2025 and a compelling theme would be unveiled by the CM Chandrababu Naidu

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Nitish government hikes monthly pension of retired journalists by ₹9,000 to ₹15,000
content: In the event of the death of a journalist receiving pension under the scheme, instructions have been given to provide their dependent/spouse with a lifetime monthly pension of ₹10,000 instead of the earlier amount of ₹3,000

title: Man ‘rapes’ minor neighbour in U.P.’s Banda, held after encounter
content: The police team surrounded the accused, who opened fire, leading to retaliation and the accused being shot in both legs

title: Cyclone havoc in Kannur: Elderly man killed, fisherman missing
content: The deceased has been identified as Eniyadan Chandran of Peruva Thettumal. The incident occurred around 2 a.m. when strong winds uprooted a tree that crashed onto his residence.

title: KKCCI seeks early environmental clearance for PM-Mitra Mega Textile Park
content: The Chamber reminded the Minister that although the prestigious PM-Mitra Mega Textile Park project was sanctioned for Kalaburagi in 2023, there has been little tangible progress on the ground over the past two years.

title: PM Modi's 'friendship' with President Trump proving to be hollow: Congress
content: The abject failure of Indian diplomacy, especially in the past two months, is revealed most tellingly by four facts. These expose the tall claims made by the Prime Minister and his drum-beaters and cheerleaders, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas: President Murmu, PM Modi lead nation to pay tributes to martyrs on 26th anniversary of ‘Operation Vijay’
content: On July 26, 1999, the Indian Army announced the successful culmination of “Operation Vijay”, declaring victory after a nearly three-month-long battle on the icy heights of Kargil in Ladakh

title: Amit Shah tells security brass to bring back fugitives involved in terror, smuggling activities
content: Amit Shah stressed enhancing inter-agency coordination between central and state law enforcement agencies, besides recalibrating the approach towards disrupting domestic nodes of the terror-criminal nexus

title: Light rains and weekend rush cause traffic snarls across Hyderabad and Cyberabad
content: Officials from the Hyderabad Traffic Control Room reported an average delay of 5–6 minutes across busy junctions.

title: Rajasthan school building collapse: Rahul Gandhi demands probe, strict punishment for culprits
content: A regular morning that saw students assembling for prayers quickly turned into tragedy when a portion of their government school building collapsed, killing seven children and injuring 27, some of them critically

title: Govindachamy shifted to Viyyur Central Jail under heavy security
content: The incident has raised serious questions about prison security protocol and the accuracy of routine checks in one of the states most fortified correctional facilities

title: ARTRAC commemorates 26 years of victory in Kargil War
content: The commemorative events of ‘Kargil Vijay Diwas’ were inaugurated in a solemn ceremony by Lieutenant General Devendra Sharma, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, ARTRAC, Shimla

title: What happened to the crypto exchange CoinDCX? | Explained
content: The breach that affected the CoinDCX exchange came almost exactly one year after a security incident that brought operations at the crypto exchange WazirX to a standstill

title: Fertile fields or solar factory: a verdant land facing an industrial leap
content: Farmers and fisherfolk of the picturesque and fertile Karedu in SPSR Nellore district fear that the massive land acquisition for an ambitious industrial project may irrevocably hurt their livelihood, but the authorities are confident about hammering out a solution through dialogue and compensation

title: Gujarat: 16-year-old girl gangraped in Porbandar; duo arrested, two on the run
content: The incident took place on July 22, while a case was registered against four persons at Udyognagar police station on July 24

title: Depression over coastal West Bengal, extremely heavy rainfall, thunderstorms likely in the State: IMD
content: The IMD also issued a warning to the fisherfolk of West Bengal, advising them not to venture along and off North and central Bay of Bengal, and West Bengal and Odisha coasts between July 25 and July 29

title: Meghalaya HC seeks action after 3,950 MT coal vanishes from depots
content: The matter came to light in a report submitted by a committee tasked with monitoring coal mining and transportation issues in the State

title: After UNESCO recognition, Maharashtra to train locals as guides at Maratha Forts
content: On July 11, 2025, 11 forts in Maharashtra and 1 fort in Tamil Nadu, were granted UNESCO World Heritage Site status. The proposal for this recognition was prepared by the Directorate of Archaeology and Museums, Department of Cultural Affairs, Government of Maharashtra.

title: Engineering aspirants in West Bengal face uncertain future over delay in West Bengal entrance test results
content: Many worry over ‘lost opportunities’ for not opting for colleges that take admission through other entrance exams; professors apprehensive of losing out on the brightest talent

title: Two Class 10 girls found to be pregnant in Odisha’s Kandhamal
content: Majority of girls with ‘unusual’ symptoms undergo health check-ups after they join schools after vacation

title: 25 die daily from drowning in West Bengal, half are children: new study finds
content: Lack of awareness, poor rescue practices, and no supervision are driving avoidable child deaths, say experts

title: Bombay High Court dismisses petition against Maharashtra’s agri procurement scheme, calls them ‘baseless’
content: The Bombay High Court imposed a cost of ₹1 lakh on the petitioners for obstructing the implementation of a State action plan aimed at enhancing oilseed productivity

title: No protest, sloganeering in M.P. Assembly, says circular for Monsoon Session; Congress slams move
content: Slamming the move, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly Umang Singhar said that the decision was taken “under pressure from the government”

title: Plastic ban to be strictly enforced along Fort Kochi beach over pollution concerns
content: Action taken report submitted to the National Green Tribunal by the District Collector on July 21 says traders and vendors have been instructed to switch to eco-friendly alternatives

title: In Bihar, a matter of life and debt
content: In Bihar, increased borrowing from multiple sources, both institutional and informal lenders, has led to excessive debt burdens. Borrowers struggle to repay loans with high interest rates while dreading recovery agents, who intimidate and harass them. Sobhana K. Nair and T.C.A. Sharad Raghavan report on the lack of political thrust on bringing in any regulatory mechanism in the State that is set to go to the polls later this year

title: Kargil, Pahalgam and a revamp of the security strategy
content: If Kargil was a watershed moment in India’s conventional fighting capability, Pahalgam has set the bar against any terror attack in the future

title: CM Fadnavis meets Union Ministers in Delhi, seeks financial assistance for projects
content: During his two-day tour to Delhi, he met Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Union Health Minister and BJP National President J.P. Nadda, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan, and NITI Aayog officials

title: Medical Student Dies By Suicide In Udaipur, Accuses Teachers Of Harassment
content: A medical student was found hanging in her hostel room in a private medical college in Udaipur, officials said on Friday.

title: 2 Andhra Cops In Car Try To Avoid Collision, Hit Speeding Lorry, Both Die
content: Additional Superintendent of Police Durga Prasad and the driver, Narsing Rao, who were also in the car, sustained serious injuries in the collision.

title: Who Is Gwyneth Paltrow, Chris Martin's Ex Hired As Astronomer's 'Temporary' Spokesperson
content: Gwyneth Paltrow was born on September 27, 1972, Los Angeles, California, to television producer Bruce Paltrow and Tony Award-winning actress Blythe Danner.

title: US-Based Women-Only App 'Tea' Hacked, 72,000 Pictures Leaked Online
content: The app has attracted interest and triggered controversy with its promise to help women avoid problematic men and get intel on dating prospects.

title: Not Just SIPs, Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta Advises What You Should Spend On
content: Edelweiss Mutual Fund CEO Radhika Gupta's message offers a reminder that personal finance is not just about saving and investing.

title: Southwest Airlines Flight Plunges 500 Feet To Avoid Mid-Air Collision, 2 Injured
content: Southwest Flight 1496 sharply descended nearly 500 feet, according to flight tracking websites, marking the second time in a week that a US commercial jet was forced to make abrupt flight maneuvers to avoid a potential mid-air collision.

title: RG Kar Victim's Father Calls Aparajita Bill 'Deceptive,' Accuses Police Of Evidence Tampering
content: The father of the RG Kar rape and murder victim accused Kolkata Police of tampering with evidence and failing to act in his daughter's case, while reacting to the Aparajita Women and Child (West Bengal Criminal Laws Amendment) Bill.

title: Savarnas And Shudras: Madhya Pradesh High Court Slams Judiciary's 'Power Dynamics'
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has drawn a shocking parallel between the treatment of district and high court judges, referring to the relationship between the higher and lower judiciary as that of "serfs" under feudal lords.

title: Thailand-Cambodia Clash: Deaths Reach 32, UN Holds Closed-Door Meet
content: The council did not issue a statement but a council diplomat said all 15 members called on the parties to deescalate, show restraint and resolve the dispute peacefully.

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas 2025: President Murmu, Rajnath Singh Honour Fallen Heroes
content: President Droupadi Murmu and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh paid heartfelt tributes to the fallen heroes of the 1999 Kargil War on Saturday.

title: "Stop The Horrible Invasion": Trump's Big Immigration Warning For Europe
content: Donald Trump has pursued a tough anti-immigration policy since he returned to the White House in January.

title: Supreme Court Lays Down 15 Guidelines To Safeguard Students' Mental Health
content: The Supreme Court on Friday issued comprehensive guidelines to protect the mental health of students in schools, colleges, and coaching centres.

title: Once Feared Extinct, Scientists Find World's Smallest Snake In Barbados
content: The Barbados threadsnake (Tetracheilostoma carlae) was found hiding under a rock in central Barbados during an ecological survey in March.

title: CBI Busts Cyber Fraud Racket In Mumbai-Pune, Arrests 3 For Duping Americans
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has busted a major international cyber fraud syndicate operating from Pune and Mumbai, arresting three accused and seizing digital devices, cash, and narcotics in coordinated raids.

title: Hyderabad Man Stabs Estranged Wife To Death At Grandniece's Birthday Party
content: The incident occurred at the accused's niece - Rajeswari's residence, where a birthday party was being hosted for her 14-year-old daughter.

title: Hyderabad Cricket Association Secretary Arrested In Pune For Misuse Of Funds
content: The Telangana Police's CID on Friday arrested Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) Secretary Devaraj Ramchander in the case of forgery, cheating, and misappropriation of funds.

title: "They Want To Die": Trump Slams Hamas As Gaza Ceasefire Talks Collapse
content: US President Donald Trump accused Hamas on Friday of not wanting to reach a ceasefire deal in Gaza as Israel said it would explore "alternative options" to rescue hostages after negotiations collapsed.

title: NASA Cuts 20% Workforce, 3,870 Employees Likely To Depart Space Agency
content: Around 3,870 individuals are expected to depart, but that number may change in the coming days and weeks, NASA spokesperson said.

title: Third US Court Halts Trump's Birthright Citizenship Order
content: A federal judge on Friday blocked the Trump administration from ending birthright citizenship for the children of parents who are in the U.S. illegally, issuing the third court ruling blocking the birthright order nationwide.

title: How Many Countries Recognise Palestine As A State?
content: Several tallies are circulating regarding the countries that recognise the State of Palestine. Here is a recap of how AFP came to its own count, identifying at least 142 states among the 193 United Nations members.

title: Draft data protection rules have received almost 7,000 comments: IT Ministry
content: Comments will not be released publicly, to allow for candid submissions; the Rules, needed to enforce the 2023 Digital Personal Data Protection Act, are yet to be notified seven months after the draft was published

title: Gram panchayat member who ‘planned’ husband’s murder arrested
content: Poison bottle with missing lid, missing slipper, and call record details help police unravel murder mystery; five men who allegedly orchestrated the murder held

title: T.N. police deny permission for PMK leader Anbumani’s padayatra
content: bBefore the decision of the police became known, the PMK leader on Friday evening launched the padayatra near Thiruporur

title: BJP’s own people not getting justice in U.P.: Akhilesh Yadav
content: In response to a video in which a BJP leader is seen accusing the U.P. police of filing a fake case against his supporters, Akhilesh Yadav said even BJP workers were “not getting justice” in the State

title: TDP MPs seek Defence Ministry support for manufacturing hubs in Andhra Pradesh
content: Delegation submits proposal from CM Chandrababu Naidu to Rajnath Singh for establishing four defence and aerospace hubs in the State

title: Anbumani Ramadoss launches padayatra to realise ‘Dr. Ayya’s dreams’
content: At a public meeting, he criticises Chief Minister M.K. Stalin for the state of law and order, violence against women, and failure to implement 10.5% internal reservation for the Vanniyars within the MBC category

title: Married women facing the heat of SIR in Bihar
content: On the last day of form submission many women are wondering where they will get the required documents of their parents when they are asked to submit after the draft of the SIR electoral roll is published on August 1, 2025

title: Debate on SIR is the top priority for Trinamool: Derek O’Brien
content: Derek O’Brien said that Trinamool will step up its protests against the government if it doesn’t allow Parliament to debate the ongoing  Special Intensive Revision in Bihar. EC has said that it will be extended to the rest of the country too

title: Modi government aided OBCs, Congress opposed reservations: Education Minister Pradhan
content: Congress leaders from Pandit Nehru to Rajiv Gandhi opposed reservations, says Dharmendra Pradhan; says it was Modi government which brought in SC, ST, OBC reservations in teaching posts in higher education

title: Chief of Integrated Defence Staff to witness multilateral exercise Talisman Sabre 2025 in Australia
content: Six officers from Indian Armed Forces are participating in TS25 as staff planners at various levels of joint operations planning, control, safety and logistics. Indian officers have earlier participated in 2021 and 2023 as observers

title: UPSC debars candidate for three years for possession of incriminating material
content: Commission invokes rule on use of unfair means; says strict action essential to uphold integrity of recruitment process

title: 23% rise in women’s employment in Bengaluru after Shakti Scheme: Study
content: However, the report flags persistent challenges, particularly around first- and last-mile connectivity

title: Rural Development Ministry skips any mention of West Bengal in written reply on MGNREGS dues
content: The scheme, which provides wage employment to rural households, remain suspended in the State since March 2022

title: Bihar SIR: survey of 338 migrant workers finds that over one-third of them do not have documents sought by EC
content: Phone survey of migrant workers from the State was conducted by the Stranded Workers Action Network (SWAN); study says the workers are most susceptible to documentation deficits

title: Govindachamy escapes from Kannur Central jail, arrested after four-hour search
content: The police came to know about the escape upon finding a makeshift rope dangling over the jail wall. Tip-offs from two local people enable police to trace the convict to a well in compound 3 km from the jail.

title: Will Modi retire at 75, asks Kharge citing RSS; Rahul calls PM ‘all show’
content: Mallikarjun Kharge said PM Modi had removed BJP veterans such as L.K Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi due to their age; Rahul Gandhi too hit out at the PM saying “there was not much substance in him”

title: 3-day The Hindu Home Expo opens at LuLu Mall in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The expo features over 125 properties by top builders. The Hindu Home Expo will be conducted at LuLu Mall, Kochi, from August 1 to 3

title: NHAI plans multiple toll booths on Bengaluru–Mysuru highway to ease burden on short-distance commuters
content: Officials say this plan will allow motorists to pay only for the distance they travel, instead of bearing the full toll cost.

title: Caught in crackdown against illegal immigrants, two Assam residents recall perilous trip across the border
content: Hands, eyes tied, asked to urinate in plastic bags, given a few hundred takas and abandoned across the border, the residents say after returning home from their ordeal. They recalled that the only thing district officials had to say after this was that it was a ‘mistake’ and that they should not ‘think too much about it’.

title: PM-KUSUM scheme: Anert CEO refutes Chennithala’s allegations
content: The programme was audited by the Principal Accountant General, Kerala, in September 2023, and no adverse findings were reported, says Narendra Nath Veluri, Anert CEO

title: Vacancies galore in Orathur Government Medical College in Nagapattinam
content: Inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2022, the medical with a 700-bed hospital has 113 vacancies spread across all departments, according to sources

title: Pre-marriage HIV/AIDS test could be made mandatory in Meghalaya
content: State’s Health Minister says a law in this regard is being considered owing to the rising number of HIV cases

title: Naidu lays out roadmap before Rajnath for defence sector investments in A.P.
content: TDP MPs submit proposals to the Defence Minister for setting up four defence and aerospace manufacturing clusters in Jaggaiahpet–Donakonda, Lepakshi–Madakasira, Visakhapatnam–Anakapalli, and Kurnool–Orvakal regions

title: Reducing pass percentage in Class X exams draws mixed reactions
content: The State government on Thursday issued a gazette notification reducing the pass percentage for SSLC exams from 35 to 33.

title: SIT takes over Dharmasthala burials case, to question complainant
content: Based on a complaint by a former sanitation worker in the temple town that he was allegedly forced to bury several bodies, an FIR was registered on July 4 and SIT was formed on July 19

title: Govt. silent on reforms to address judicial misconduct
content: Responding to a question in Lok Sabha whether reforms were required in the Supreme Court’s in-house procedure, Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal only described the existing rules and regulations for removal of judges

title: 185 displaced persons granted Indian citizenship under CAA in Gujarat
content: Beneficiaries from Pakistan receive citizenship certificates in Rajkot after years of waiting; Gujarat Minister calls it “restoration of dignity and rights”

title: ‘When data talks, Bengaluru congestion quits’: IISc scientist backs open data for seamless city mobility
content: Namma Transit, currently available to a select group of users and set for a wider rollout in the coming week, provides real-time journey planning across different modes of transport.

title: ‘Joote khane bhej dia...’: When Pak DGMO came for key talks; how the meet helped end the Kargil War
content: In July 1999, as Pakistani troops retreated during the Kargil War, PM Vajpayee arranged a DGMO-level meeting at Attari. Lt Gen Bhandari recalls his surprise at seeing Pak DGMO Lt Gen Zia arrive alone, lamenting he was sent to 'take the blows' by PM Nawaz Sharif.

title: Cambodia calls for immediate ceasefire with Thailand; 13 killed in border clashes
content: Cambodia urged an immediate ceasefire with Thailand following two days of intense cross-border conflict. The clashes occurred near the Preah Vihear and Prasat Ta Muen Thom temples. Both nations exchanged rockets and artillery fire. The United Nations Security Council addressed the situation. Casualties included soldiers and civilians on both sides.

title: 'Missed important meeting': Air India flyers spend 2 hours in plane after taxiing
content: An Air India flight (AI-2982) from Delhi to Pune experienced a technical issue on Friday, causing significant delays for its 150 passengers. After taxiing, the Airbus A-320 returned to the bay, leaving passengers waiting anxiously for two hours. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of communication and missed business meetings.

title: Kerala jailbreak: Officials clueless on how Govindachamy escaped prison; found hiding in well
content: Govindachamy, a life convict notorious for the 2011 rape and murder case, escaped from Kannur Central Prison early Friday. Authorities discovered his absence during a morning inspection, finding clothes hanging from the prison wall. A statewide manhunt was launched, leading to his apprehension within hours after a local resident's tip-off.

title: ‘Stop immigration and … wind mills’: Trump tells Europe to get its ‘act together’
content: Donald Trump visited Scotland for five days. He spoke about immigration in Europe. Trump criticised wind energy and praised his administration's immigration policies. He visited his golf courses. Trump is scheduled to meet UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. He has family ties to Scotland. A state visit is planned for September.

title: Vice President JD Vance on AI taking jobs: If the robots were coming to take all of our jobs, you would ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: 'He'll break Tendulkar's record in 2027': Vaughan's bold prediction for Root
content: Joe Root's magnificent 150 in the fourth Test propelled him past Dravid, Kallis, and Ponting, securing the second-highest run-scorer position in Test cricket. Michael Vaughan boldly predicted Root would surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record in 2027, while Ricky Ponting also supported Root's potential to become No. 1. Root's 38th century ties him with Sangakkara, potentially shaping the series outcome.

title: Karnataka Bhavan row: Siddaramaiah, DKS aides clash in Delhi
content: A public dispute erupted in Delhi between aides of Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar at Karnataka Bhavan. The confrontation involved alleged threats and abusive language, leading to formal complaints and calls for an inquiry. The Chief Minister has directed an investigation into the matter following complaints from women staff regarding the DCM's aide's behavior.

title: Bill Gates' daughter asks if he’d be willing to work a shift in customer service
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: Watch | De Villiers names top batters and bowlers across formats: 'Kallis, ...'
content: AB de Villiers, the South African legend, recently shared his all-time top three batters and bowlers across all formats, sparking debate among cricket fans. His picks for batters include Jacques Kallis, Ricky Ponting, and Virat Kohli, while his bowlers list features Mohammad Asif, Dale Steyn, and Glenn McGrath.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: Indian embassy issues advisory; shares helpline numbers
content: The Indian embassy in Cambodia has advised its citizens to avoid traveling to the Cambodia-Thailand border due to ongoing clashes. Similar advisory was issued by the Indian embassy in Thailand, urging travelers to stay updated on local conditions. The conflict has resulted in numerous casualties and displacement of thousands, prompting international concern and a United Nations Security Council emergency meeting.

title: Risking lives on piggyback: Himachal kids brave perilous journeys to school
content: In Himachal Pradesh's Bharmour, students face peril daily. They must cross a raging rivulet to attend school. Villagers plead for a bridge or culvert. Their requests remain unanswered. Pilgrims visiting Banni Mata temple also suffer. The Chamba deputy commissioner promised a culvert before the next monsoon. This will channel water under the road. It will ensure safer passage for all.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock to employees: You cannot carry your phones and laptops to China, instead …
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: IND vs ENG: 'A major red flag' - Ex-India cricketer slams Shubman Gill's captaincy
content: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has criticised Shubman Gill's captaincy during the fourth Test against England, highlighting the delayed introduction of Washington Sundar as a significant concern. Despite the pitch favoring spin, Gill's reluctance to utilise Sundar until the 69th over, even after his impactful performance at Lord's, drew sharp criticism.

title: 75+ Kargil Vijay Diwas 2025: Wishes, messages, quotes, images
content: Kargil Vijay Diwas, observed annually on July 26th, commemorates the courage and sacrifice of Indian soldiers during the Kargil War. It serves as a potent reminder of their unwavering dedication and unity in defending the nation's integrity amidst challenging conditions.

title: 'Dust, sweat and blood': White House uses Roosevelt speech to cast Trump as fighter
content: The White House invoked Theodore Roosevelt's "Man in the Arena" speech to portray Donald Trump as a resilient leader confronting adversity. An image of Trump in a Roman-style arena accompanied the quote, emphasizing his determination amidst controversies, including recent allegations.

title: Texas Democrat dragged out of meeting for yelling, officer falls on him – watch video
content: During a contentious redistricting hearing in Austin, Democratic congressional candidate Isaiah Martin was forcibly removed and arrested after exceeding his speaking time and refusing to stop. The incident escalated when security officers dragged him out, leading to a scuffle. Martin faced charges of criminal trespass, disrupting a meeting, and resisting arrest, but all charges were subsequently dropped.

title: Who after Kohli & Dhoni? Shastri reveals India's next pin-up boy: 'He's young, fresh …’
content: Ravi Shastri has identified Shubman Gill as the next potential superstar of Indian cricket, poised to emulate the endorsement success of Sachin Tendulkar, MS Dhoni, and Virat Kohli. Shastri highlighted Gill's leadership, batting prowess, and youthful appeal as key factors, predicting he will become a prominent figure in Indian cricket.

title: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson pens emotional tribute to Hulk Hogan - WATCH
content: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson paid tribute to Hulk Hogan, his childhood hero and friend, following Hogan's death from cardiac arrest at 71. Johnson shared an emotional Instagram post recalling their WrestleMania X8 match and a touching childhood memory. He remembered Hogan gifting him a headband after their initial meeting, highlighting the profound impact Hogan had on his life and career.

title: What is Tea? Women-only app hit by massive data breach; it lets women review men
content: Tea, a women-only dating advice app, experienced a data breach exposing approximately 72,000 user images. The leaked data included selfies with photo IDs used for verification and images from posts and direct messages. The company confirmed the breach affected users who signed up before February 2024 and is working with cybersecurity experts to secure its systems.

title: Air pollution increases dementia risk, finds Cambridge study
content: New research links air pollution to dementia risk. Tiny particles can harm the brain. Pollution may cause cognitive decline, especially in older adults. Damage can start early in life. Reduce exposure by checking air quality. Stay indoors during pollution spikes. Ventilate homes and support clean air policies. Protect your brain from invisible threats. Prioritize cleaner air for better brain health.

title: Rishabh Pant's reckless shot sparks debate: 'He has only himself to blame'
content: Rishabh Pant sustained a foot fracture during the Manchester Test against England while attempting a reverse sweep, raising concerns about his availability and sparking debate over injury substitutes. Geoffrey Boycott criticised Pant's shot selection, deeming the injury avoidable, while David Lloyd suggested considering like-for-like replacements for severe injuries, excluding strategic substitutions.

title: Kidney damage explained: How diabetes and hypertension damage your kidneys
content: Kidneys, vital organs often overlooked, diligently filter blood, manage waste, and regulate crucial bodily functions. Diabetes and hypertension are major threats, damaging kidney vessels and impairing filtration. Other causes include infections, genetic factors, medications, and obstructions. Maintaining healthy blood sugar and pressure, staying hydrated, and cautious medication use are crucial for kidney health.

title: Klay Thompson in courtside chaos; Tory Lanez-Megan drama hits NBA game
content: Golden State Warriors' Klay Thompson faced an uncomfortable encounter in New York City when a stranger questioned him about Tory Lanez's rumored release, referencing Megan Thee Stallion's ex. Thompson, visibly annoyed, told the person to leave him alone. Fans have rallied in support of Thompson, criticizing the stranger's intrusion into his personal life.

title: Just 50 air-launched weapons pulverised Pak, says IAF vice-chief
content: Operation Sindoor, where India launched under 50 air-launched weapons at Pakistani airbases and radar sites, compelled Pakistan to negotiate, according to IAF Vice Chief Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari. CDS General Anil Chauhan emphasized the need for constant operational readiness, noting the operation's ongoing relevance. Speakers at a seminar highlighted aerospace power's strategic importance and India's new red line against nuclear blackmail.

title: 'Saiyaara' BO collection day 8: Mohit Suri's romantic drama crossed Rs 190cr mark
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has achieved remarkable success at the Indian box office, surpassing ₹190 crore on its second Friday. The film's emotional resonance with audiences propelled it past 'Housefull 5' and 'Raid 2,' positioning it to enter the coveted ₹200 crore club.

title: Josh Allen reacts as sister launches baby clothing line; brand honors Bills QB
content: Josh Allen's sister, Nicala Madden, launched a baby clothing line called Little Dreamers Co., featuring a special collection named "17 Sideline Snuggles" as a tribute to Allen's jersey number. The Buffalo Bills quarterback expressed his pride and support for his sister's new venture.

title: History made: 11 sixes! Tim David smashes fastest T20I century for Australia
content: Tim David's explosive 37-ball century propelled Australia to a dominant victory against the West Indies in St. Kitts, securing an unassailable 3-0 series lead. David's record-breaking innings, featuring 11 sixes, included a blistering 128-run partnership with Mitchell Owen.

title: Israel makes Arabic, Islam studies compulsory for intelligence officials; here's why
content: Following intelligence failures preceding the October 7th attacks, the Israeli military is overhauling its intelligence training. The reforms, led by Major General Shlomi Binder, mandate Arabic language and Islamic cultural studies for all intelligence personnel, including those in technological roles.

title: 'Where's he been?': Ex-England captain slams India over delayed Sundar spell
content: Nasser Hussain has criticised India's captain Shubman Gill for delaying Washington Sundar's introduction into the attack during the fourth Test, despite Sundar's previous success at Lord's. Hussain also questioned India's bowling strategy against Joe Root, suggesting they should have used more short balls. Root's dominant innings has put England in a commanding position, intensifying scrutiny on India's tactical choices.

title: Woman seeks INR 12cr alimony, BMW, luxury flat after 18-month marriage
content: The Supreme Court of India has emphasized that financially capable women should strive for self-reliance rather than seeking substantial alimony, especially in short marriages. This stance was highlighted during a case involving an IT professional seeking significant assets after only 18 months of marriage.

title: US regulator: Quite sure no issue with AI 171 fuel switch
content: FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford suggests the AI 171 crash wasn't due to mechanical failure or accidental fuel control switch movement. He stated that they are confident that the crash was not due to mechanical issues with the Boeing fuel control unit. Indian authorities are investigating the crash and have requested patience for the final report.

title: $565m credit line for Maldives, talks on free trade pact
content: India and Maldives have revitalized their relationship, marked by PM Modi's visit and a new $565 million line of credit. Agreements were signed to reduce Maldives' debt burden and boost economic cooperation through investment and trade. Both nations affirmed their commitment to security in the region, focusing on development projects and defense cooperation.

title: Ciara and baby Amora twin in sweet snap: Fans gush over cuteness
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson's daughter, Amora Princess, is growing up. A recent photo shows Amora resembles her father, Russell Wilson. The family celebrated milestones, including Sienna's birthday and their 9th anniversary. Russell Wilson transitioned to the New York Giants. Ciara shares glimpses of Amora. The Wilsons balance family, fame, and football. They co-parent Future with unity.

title: YesJulz breaks silence: 'Leave me out of it'; LeBron slammed for dancing to Kendrick’s Drake diss
content: LeBron James ignited controversy by dancing to Kendrick Lamar's Drake diss track in Cannes, drawing social media influencer YesJulz into the fray. Years after infidelity rumors involving James surfaced, YesJulz has now broken her silence, posting "Leave me out of it" on X. The rumors began in 2014 when James played for the Miami Heat.

title: Who is Sky Daily? Hulk Hogan’s wife sparks curiosity; age gap, love story & wedding revealed
content: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, married Sky Daily in September 2023, marking his third marriage. Their relationship, which began in 2022, has drawn attention due to their 25-year age gap. Despite family drama involving Hogan's ex-wife and daughter, the couple remains focused on their shared faith and fitness, solidifying their bond.

title: RBI governor rules out banking licences for corporates
content: Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra stated that corporates will not be allowed banking licenses. The monetary policy committee retains flexibility on interest rates. Future rate decisions will depend on inflation and growth outlook. There is no plan to revise the 26% limit on promoter shareholding in private banks. RBI supports diversified ownership. The ultimate responsibility for a bank's operations lies with its board.

title: Guv returns Bengal rape bill after Centre flags concerns; TMC opposes
content: West Bengal Governor C V Ananda Bose sent back the Aparajita bill. The reason is objections from the central government. The Centre believes the bill proposes excessively harsh punishments for rape. The bill suggests life imprisonment or capital punishment for rape. The Centre also opposed removing stricter penalties for sexual assault of minors.

title: AI 171 fallout: After crash, red flags, govt & Air India brainstorm on safety - details
content: Following recent incidents and regulatory scrutiny, the Tata Group and the aviation ministry are collaborating to revitalise Air India. Discussions between N Chandrasekaran, aviation minister Ram Mohan Naidu, and airline management focused on addressing maintenance issues, leadership, and communication strategies. The priority is to restore flyer confidence by emphasizing safety over rapid growth, potentially involving Singapore Airlines more visibly in the process.

title: ‘Never’: Trump denies being told his name was in Epstein files
content: Donald Trump denied being briefed about his name appearing in Jeffrey Epstein's files, contradicting a Wall Street Journal report. He dismissed questions about Ghislaine Maxwell's interview and a potential pardon, stating it's not the right time. Trump shifted focus to others associated with Epstein, accusing the media of exaggerating his involvement.

title: 'Student suicides a systemic failure': SC issues directions on 'mental health crisis'
content: The Supreme Court, addressing the alarming rise in student suicides due to academic pressure, has mandated mental health safeguards in all educational institutions, including coaching centers. The directive includes appointing counselors, avoiding performance-based batch segregation, and providing mandatory mental health training for staff. The court lamented the education system's focus on rankings over holistic development.

title: Centre suggests 'country of origin' filter on e-commerce sites
content: The consumer affairs department has proposed that e-commerce companies add a "country of origin" filter to their websites and apps, enabling consumers to quickly select products based on their preferred country. While industry players generally agreed on the feasibility, concerns were raised about potential algorithm changes, compliance burdens for inventory-holding companies, and space constraints on mobile devices.

title: NDA meeting to finalise VP candidate after PM Modi's return
content: With PM Modi's return imminent, NDA parties are poised to finalize their vice-presidential candidate, likely from BJP, leveraging their parliamentary majority. The chosen candidate will possess political and legislative experience, aligning with organizational values. Electoral considerations in upcoming Bihar and other state polls will influence the selection, as the vice president's role is crucial in shaping Parliament's agenda.

title: 4 bids made by BJP-JD(U) people to kill Tejashwi, claims Rabri
content: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi has alleged that there have been four attempts to assassinate her son, Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, blaming BJP-JD(U) members. She claims these attempts occurred on the road and conspiracies are still being hatched in Patna. These allegations follow recent incidents involving Tejashwi's security, including a speeding car, a drone crash, and a truck hitting his convoy.

title: Rajnath to initiate debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha on Monday
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is scheduled to initiate a discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, with PM Modi expected to intervene. This debate aims to address concerns surrounding alleged intelligence failures and US President Trump's ceasefire claims. The government has expressed readiness to discuss all issues, including the Pahalgam attack, seeking to restore normalcy to Parliament after disruptions.

title: How Jen Welter’s hiring by the Cardinals has changed the NFL landscape for women
content: a decade ago, when she was 12, she was her first love . her father, former Div. III player Lawyer Wilson, Jr., taught her the game . she is entering her second season as an assistant coach with the Buffalo Bills .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

content: a new team atop our power rankings after the first week of the second half . the Brewers were the biggest riser in Week 17 going from No. 9 in our final rankings before the All-Star break to No. 1 . in the American League, the Tigers have been overtaken by the Astros and Blue Jays .
